I have been off opiates for 3 years now thanks to kratom & a shit-load of willpower.
I decided to quit about a month ago and for the first time, I felt like I was mentally done with the shit.

I loved every single second of every high, but I just love life more than drugs now. It blows my mind that I'm sitting in an apartment two hours away from home and I can stay as long as I want because I don't have a chemical tethering me to a specific place.
Over the past month, I couldn't take a damn nap to save my life.
I quit cold turkey and I don't go to NA/AA. I'm ridiculously proud of this.
I celebrated when I found a fentanyl patch in my room at two-ish months clean and was able to throw that shit in the trash.
I can't imagine being out in the rain or snow and experiencing withdrawal, praying that someone will come through or that you can scrounge up enough money to pick up and not be sick.

I have 16 months clean as of Monday, and I'm going in for oral surgery tomorrow because the worst of my many bad teeth has been keeping me awake for days. I'm hungry but can't chew, exhausted but can't sleep. I'm mentally and physically drained, and to make it worse, tooth pain is what started my addiction in the first place so it's really triggering for me and making me panic.
So I blow all my opiates by choice, except of course for the ones that need an oral ROA such as morphine or the new opanas and oxys. This includes all opiates, even dope insufflated, not just pills.

I've been told the standard 5-Panel tests only look for morphine metabolites which only covers smack, morphine and codine which would put me in the clear with my oxy use. Any knowledge on the matter from my fellow bropiates? I was told it's a urine test, just not sure on how comprehensive a test it is.
